I gave them 2 stars because at least their overpriced fried chicken is good. But we won't be back for wings and drinks.

Really good fried chicken & the meatloaf isn't bad either. Is it anything to write home about, no, but the food was good enough for me to go back. The service is a little below average. They never brought our coffee with our dessert, and we had to ask for drink refills, but that's to be expected from time to time. I would recommend some deep cleaning (tables and chairs were a little dirty).

We went to lunch here on Saturday after my son's baseball game. It started out bad as the hostess was on the phone for over five minutes taking reservations while people stood there waiting.  Then she proceeded to seat someone in front of us. OK then we finally got seated and waited 15 minutes for Someone to come to us. Then another hour to get our food As they brought others food out in front of ours that got seated well after we did. Then of course the food was cold. We couldn't wait to get out of there. Poor management.  Do not go to this place. Tourist usually get roped in on it, and locals usually know better, we do now.

Went to the Horny Toad for dinner tonight.  The fried chicken was very good.  Tried a little of the barbecue sauce and that was good too.  Unfortunately too full for the desert.  Will have to save that for another time.

I went to the Horny Toad with a party of five.  Sadly there are few redeeming qualities to this place, all of which are in no way associated the actual restaurant.  The decor makes the place look like an abandon mine shaft.  The food was horrible.  The salads consisted of shredded iceberg lettuce and a few uninspiring toppings.  The restaurant did provide a bucket of salad dressing to allow the diner to drown the insipid salad in.  The grade of the ribs was sub-standard and permanently marked from the jockey whip.  During dinner we had several uninvited guests visit us (beetles/roaches).  We found one on our menu, one in the basket of fries, and several more littered around the establishment.  Since I did not see any outside the restaurant, I can only conclude that they lived in the kitchen.  Cave Creek is a beautiful setting.  I highly recommend taking the time to drive up there, but give the Horny Toad a pass, unless you are a gourmand in entomophagy. (I wish yelp allowed zero star ratings)

We took some out of town family there yesterday (12/26/15). Boy, were we disappointed! Only thing that was good was my granddaughters chicken strips. Rack of ribs dry and not much flavor. Fajitas, well don't order it if you expect real a Mexican serving. Lettuce looked like it came out of a bag. Guacamole and sour cream came in little store bought containers. I always got black beans not black olives as a side. In fairness I have been there in the spring and had better food.

What a disappointment I had the fried chicken.when it arrived at the table I thought I had gotten the wrong order.A basket that contained four tiny pieces of way overcooked chicken.I couldn't
even tell what price was which.I left hungry stopped at Micky D's on the way home

I was in Cave Creek to visit family and we decided to eat at The Horny Toad. I honestly wasn't sure what to expect based on the name, but I took a leap-of-faith and went with it anyways. It definitely has an a unique look to it, with a very heavy Western influence. The staff was nice and friendly and the place was clean.

At first I thought the menu was a bit expensive but ordered the Mushroom Swiss burger anyways. Much to my surprise, the burger was huge! Not only was it huge, but it was tasty too. 

There were 7 other people in my group and everybody liked what they ordered. There were free refills on soda which was a nice touch. Overall, I recommend eating here if you're looking for good American food. There's also a nice outdoor patio to eat on if the weather is nice (it was a bit cold when we were there).
Wonderful place to eat after a long long road trip to the Grand Canyon, also a great family restaurant.

My husband and I had lunch here after reading a review in the AaA magazine. We'd never been to cave creek before, so decided to take a quick trip. There are many restaurants in this vicinity so was a bit surprised as I expected more even though yelp said 3 stars. I had the pulled pork sandwich and my husband had half of a fried chicken. There was nothing wrong with the food, it was good but very ordinary. The French fries weren't crisp at all but they were homemade.  Our server did everything we asked, got the food out fast and our check when we asked. It had a great ambience and the food was middle of the road. It wasn't our type of place but can see how many others would really enjoy it.
Faux  old west interior in a tourist trap area.  But the food was decent bar food and it would be fun on a nice afternoon.

When we were passing through town we stopped at The Horny Toad for lunch. I have to say my experience was just "ok".  The chicken noodle soup lacked any substance.  My girlfriend had the chile and commented that said "shes had better".  We sat outside on the picnic tables which is a cute spot but certaily nothing special.  I doubt I would make a special trip to town just to go to this place.  Server however was expeptional and staff very friendly.

When you need comfort food and a great time with your family or friends, this is the spot. When my family comes from out of state, they always have to make it a point to stop here. Fried chicken is great and the bbq ribs are my favorite. Huge portions of deliciousness. Strawberry shortcake and the cobbler are a party in your mouth!
The meatloaf was cold and underwhelming. The service was slow and unfriendly. I was excited to eat here because of the reviews but I will never go again.

Stopped off here late on a Sunday night when my parents and I were driving through town. I saw that the fried chicken was popular so we ordered that. It was pretty juicy, worth trying for sure. It was quite greasy though....Like exploded with grease when I took a bite. 

Pros: fun atmosphere 
-Quality napkins
-Pretty good service 
-Chicken was juicy 


Cons: Dirty bathroom 
-Coleslaw was like shredded lettuce dumped with mayo
-Super uncomfurtable seating

Awful.  Rude and incompetent staff, food was gross, ribs were rubbery and overcooked.  Clearly unless you know the people that work there they don't want you there.  
We reordered food after sending the first lot back,  couldn't get drinks,  food took so long we canceled it and as we were walking out the food showed up,  I told them we didn't want it and the manager says "really? " and slammed the food on the bar.
Asked for the check for what we'd had and was told to go to the bar to pay,  I refused and wanted to pay where I was,  was promptly sworn at.  I was getting annoyed as was my wife and we asked for the freaking bill only to be told to quit yelling and was told this is f@#kin shit. I said I was ready to put money on the counter and walk out to which I was told that was a stupid idea. 
Paid for what we ate and left an absolutely dreadful restaurant with awful employees,  awful food and terrible service. 
Not even worth 1 star.  
Do NOT give these idiots your business.  Loads of way better places to spend your hard earned cash in Cave Creek.
I'm visiting here from Va and it was my first time visiting here. The food was fresh , service was amazing, and quick! The fried chicken is a MUST try. The restaurant is so cute. I will go back !
Great variety - good for families - perfect Fried Chicken!
Best fried chicken in Cave Creek! Love the atmosphere and service was great. Just took a long time to get Bill payed

YUMMY !!!!! pERFECT,,,order FISH&CHIPS  I am from Pacific northwest we are fish country.These fish&CHIPS AWESOME..Went back for fried chicken KEEP UP GREAT WORK ..your kitchen staff 10stars we come from glendale..LOVE horny toad.

Go for the apple crisp dessert but that's about it.  Companions weren't thrilled with their ribs and steak I had was way past it's prime and had to be replaced with another.  Garlic bread is delicious and buttery but not worth the rest of the meal.  Come here for dessert and have dinner somewhere else. I'
We always have a good time here! Good food, good service and fun atmosphere. We love sitting on the porch and people watching over a casual meal.

I ordered the Taco Salad.
Worst Taco Salad ever. Nothing about it was Taco, except that it came in a taco shell.
No beans, no Mexican rice. Just lettuce, black olives, tomatoes, and cheese.
Sour cream and mushy guacamole on the side. No flavor.
food excellent for location and if you want next door has a bar just for bikers, don't say anything stupid.

A unique locals restaurant.   The decor is cowboy style.  Reasonably priced food.  Everyone seems pleasant.  For a treat you really have to get their home made strawberry shortcake.   It comes heated,  and the portion size that you can split 4 ways with everyone getting plenty.

This place is pretty good, but falls short of five stars. It serves large portions of pretty decent comfort food, a variety of salads for which they put dressing on the side w/out asking, and good deserts that fit well with the overall ambiance and menu. Last time I had liver with onions - liver was coded in flower and egg wash which was too salty. The liver was a tad overlooked, so it as rubbery. Fried chicken was amazing and so moist! Salads were fresh. Both types of chicken on them, grilled and fried, were moist and very nicely seasoned. Cod in Fish n Chips dish was perfect. It's a casual place that offers relaxed and comfortable atmosphere both inside and outside.
In town for work. Nice place to get a good meal. I had the pot roast which was good. Ate alone but got a booth. Nice waiter and a constant flow of people coming and going.

Went here for dinner on July 3rd.  Great place to hang out for best firework show I have seen in Az (in my opinion).  Place was busy so I would to give our server a break but she vanished!!! Their management is too blame in our opinion.  We found out she was working tables all over the restaurant.  They need to section the restaurant off better for their servers.  They have people running all over the place doing their best but not really serving the customers. 

The Cobb salad was surprisingly good as was the chili.  If you like greasy.. Go for the fried chicken.

I'm a native, and this is one of my guilty pleasures. 

I've been going to The Horny Toad with my parents since I can remember. My mom and I stopped in for lunch and it wasn't very busy. Our server came right out and was very pleasant. 

I don't think I've ever ordered anything here besides the deep fried zucchini and the fried chicken.  (Like I said one of my guilty pleasures)

The deep fried zucchini are delicious, but be careful, they can be super hot when they hit your plate.

The fried chicken on the menu is listed as "Our Famous Fried Chicken" "Plucked & Fresh NOT Frozen". They're not using that term lightly, it's definitely famous in my mind. Carve into that bird and the succulent juices start running down your knife. With your fist bite your whole mouth bursts with flavor.  I could almost eat the whole bird... seriously they serve you an entire chicken.  You can order the "half" option but you'll be disappointed without the left overs.

I don't think they've changed the recipe in 20 years and I'll be back for many more years to come.

Worst experience I've had in a long time. Service, while friendly, was slow or non existent. Food was over cooked and way over priced. I had to go to the bar for more water and beer. My waitress was MIA. And to top it off we couldn't get our darn bill to get the heck out. We will never return. If 0 stars was possible I would have picked that.
Nice ride to Cave Creek.  Excellent chicken with mashed potatoes & gravy.  The Hamburger was excellent also.  Service was great.  We'll see you again soon.
Very cool place!  Good food (I had pork chops) really great deserts!

Started with a good Moscow Mule but went downhill from there. Wanted to order the special with two pieces of chicken and ribs. Was told you couldn't request white meat if you ordered the special- you got what they gave you. So maybe they should have just said the special came with two pieces of dark meat! Were also told you couldn't order, and pay for, an extra piece of chicken to add to the meal. And all this came from a surly waitress. When the entrees came out of course our special came with two pieces of dark meat- when we asked again why no option for white we were told you take what you get. They serve white meat because we had it in our (full price) half chicken dinner. The chicken was good- not great. The ribs were terrible as were the fries and the mashed potatoes and gravy. Cole slaw was okay. Never asked if we wanted drink refills. All in all, customer service stinks and there are a lot of much better food options nearby.

So maybe the customer service isn't all that bubbly but when you step into "The Horny Toad" you are stepping back in time when customer service was mediocre at best, right?  So with that said, the food is what we really need to focus on and it's delicious!  They have the best cottage cheese that I've ever had and their potato salad is amazing.  Also, their tangy and sweet BBQ sauce is perfection.  Love the ambiance and the old western feel... definitely worth the drive.

All I can say is fried chicken!  Again, we have been going here for years and never once had bad service.  Friendly staff and always good food.  The fried chicken is juicy and tasty and is my staple when we go.

I've probably been coming here for over 20 years, first time was with my Dad years ago. The food is always very good. Back in the day before gluten became an issue, I used to enjoy the fried chicken. Boy how I miss that chicken! But alas, sometimes with age comes digestive issues. I still enjoy the BBQ, often get the pork or beef sandwiches, just without the bread, the fries are good and the slaw is just right, not too sweet, not too vinegary (is that a word?)  It's always fun to sit outside on the patio on a beautiful day. Sometimes they have musicians play outside and that's always a treat. Service is always good. This place is a definitely must if you have out of town visitors! The whole town of Cave Creek is kind of a throw back, really neat.
Great food and even better people and atmosphere. Nice little Cave Creek spot. Definitely try to get there before the crowds.

Half fried chicken. Came with coleslaw and choice of mash and gravy or fries.
BEST onion rings ever
Amazing porch view
Friendliest and efficient servers

YUMMY
Great food great service just had fantasic bacon blue burger also had torpedo burger and pulled pork sandwich and shared. All recommended

My husband and I enjoyed our dinner here.  The burger was ok.  They fried chicken was really good.  Great BBQ sauce too.  Our waitress was really friendly.  We enjoyed eating outside, before the sun went down and it got too cool.

We hadn't been there in years, my wife had the horny toad Burger and I had the combo chicken and ribs, best chicken and ribs ever, wife loved the hamburger, service
 great, ambiance great.....one thing tho, the door to the toliet stall is so high up it provides no privacy if one had to go number 2.... so as long as u don't have to do number 2, you'll be alright...

Yikes! The new owners are terminating all the older well seasoned waitstaff and now they got rid of the best chef in Cave Creek who had been there 30 years! My late father ran 5 star resorts in this area with world class restaurants. Believe me the food and dining experience at the Horny Toad will never be the same quality we all have enjoyed for decades. There are better cowboy restaurants in Cave Creek!
Went here for the first time earlier in the week.   BBQ Beef ribs were awesome.  Kids food was good.   Service was pretty good.   Dog friendly patio was great.  We will be back!

Iconic and fun spot for soaking up the local atmosphere, drinking a cold beer and eating their unbelievable FRIED CHICKEN.  I dream of this chicken--it reminds me of the chicken my grandmother made on her Missouri farm, killing and cleaning the chickens just before seasoning and placing into hot fat on the stove. Never frozen, unbelievably moist inside and delicious crunchiness on the outside--I will miss this meal as I have just moved out of state. (Oh yeah--review not complete without mentioning how very good the fries are alongside).

We read many reviews about Horny Toad, so gave it a try. We really enjoyed the delicious fried and BBQ chicken. They are very generous with the mashed potatoes and gravy as well. Cole slaw was sweet, creamy, and tasty. We split the a half order of the signature strawberry shortcake for dessert as well. Came away very satisfied. Loved the indoor ambience and country music too. It did take a while for our order to be served, but it was hot, fresh, and tasty. You will not be disappointed.

I went here today to try the famous fried chicken. I was looking forward to trying it.
Although the chicken was very moist it did not have the crispy deep fried  outer skin you expect from fried chicken. I was disappointed to say the least..

The attitude and service provided by our server was subpar at best. We felt as though we were an inconvenience. Short one word answers and at one point she simply pointed at the menu and walked away. We waited so long for a second beverage I just went to the bar. Food was average at best. 1st and only visit that's for certain.

I had a problem with the service on my last visit a couple months ago, but that was not the case tonight. 
We arrived as a large group this time, but our server handled it pretty well, even with a few last minute additions and changes. 
I came with a couple people who don't eat pork, so I didn't get my usual baby back ribs (cutting a streak of over 15yrs!)... Instead, I got the beef ribs. My husband and his parents also got the same. They were enormous! But also good. I still prefer the baby back, but the beef isn't bad at all.  My husband and his parents also enjoyed them. 
My mother enjoyed her fajita, and my dad and brother shared and enjoyed the whole fried chicken. 
My daughter got chicken nuggets. They were dinosaur shaped, so I doubt they were made there, but she didn't mind.

Service was extremely mediocre. I asked for a menu recommendation and received a look of contempt and a very stock answer. We ordered fried chicken and a burger, and both were mediocre as well. My girlfriend asked for her burger cooked medium and they gave it to her raw. My chicken was almost tasteless with no seasoning-I've gotten better chicken from the grocery store for half the price. Will never come back. For $30 we got terrible, inattentive service and food that tasted like something they heated up from Winco.

We had a party of 50 here tonight. The manager Jim planned and executed the most awesome night for us. Ashley and Kathy were our servers. We had excellent food, awesome service and an enjoyable time. We were in an out of this restaurant in less than two hours. Thank you for a remarkable evening!

This place could be a lot cooler than it actually is.  It always feels a bit clasustrophobic in here.  Walking from the entrance to the dining room is difficult because of the narrow pathway and all the people walking back and forth.  The service is usually pretty decent though.  The food is okay. Nothing special.

Best fried chicken in town! its exactly what every true fried chicken lover wants there chicken to be! 
service, well its exactly what i expected, no frills at all. but if your not needy, snobby or pretentious you'll fit right in.
this place is overflowing with small town character and pride, which i think is a good thing.
con- beer should have been colder.
all in all a pretty neat old restaurant
Fried Chicken & Ribs - delicious and out of the ordinary for me to order. Very cool old western bar up in Cave Creek (super easy to get to). Worth the trip.

Not as touristy as some of the other places on old town cave creek, but a decent blend of cheesiness and vintage old west decor.  

The fried chicken is what we came for, based on other yelp reviews, and it proved to be just what we were looking for.  

Call me crazy, but I do tend to measure fried chicken against KFC, not that KFC is the gold standard, but it does provide a good measuring stick.  

Toad's fried chicken has a good crispy exterior that generously coats the entire piece.  I would have liked a little more salt and juiciness to the meat itself (brine or buttermilk?), but if you ensure that each bite is a blend of skin/meat, you'll be happy.  

Fried are some of the best in CC, and the slaw is right up there as well.   

All in all, this meal hit the spot and we WILL come back again for the fried chicken.

This is the place we take company when they visit the area.  The menu has great choices.  They are famous for the fried chicken-its outstanding.  We are always amazed at how fast the service is and the waitstaff is friendly!  Its charm, wooden floors, stone fireplace and patio dining make this one of our favorite- comfortable places in Cave Creek.

The horny toad in Cavecreek is the best restaurant in town for your pride chicken and or strawberry shortcake everything was delicious the waitress JC is marvelous and the manager Laurie is fantastic we had a wonderful time and great service great food and fun fun fun

The most amazing food I have had in my entire life!  We sat on the nice patio which is pet friendly by the way and enjoyed the breeze while we ate. Thank you!!! We will be coming back for years to come!!!!!

The waitstaff was quick and friendly anticipating our needs for drinks, dressings, and even extra napkins. 

I even took the time to PERSONALLY THANK the cook for an outstanding job!

I remember thinking it was so funny that the Satisfied Frog was right down the road basically from the Horny Toad.  I mean, was the Frog totally getting all the action?  The Toad was left so totally unsatisfied? (Yes, I know what a horny toad is. I am a native, remember?  But as a kid these things are hilarious.)

Strangely enough, that's kinda how it looks.  The Satisfied Frog will have tons of people being brought in by the bus load.  The Horny Toad was always fairly easy to get into.  I feel like the Satisfied Frog actually takes some of the heat off of the Horny Toad so that it could be a better place, but sometimes I think it's trying too hard to just be like the Frog.  

Yea, it's kinda touristy, but it's also really close to some other cool spots.  Do the big Cave Creek loop and, if you're not going for high cuisine, stop here first.  Grab some casual - but not super high quality - grub at the Toad, hang out and watch the tourists while you eat.  Then go over to the Town Dump right down the street.  You've just experienced Cave Creek.  You can now finish the loop and end up in Scottsdale for the rest of your tourist shopping.  One more city checked off your guest's list and you didn't have to fight through bus loads of people.

My husband remembered loving this place as a kid, so we went again. Fun looking atmosphere, but that's the best it gets. We had horrible service. It was a Monday night at 8pm. Looked Busy when we got there but most people were finishing up, so we were surprised by how poor the service was here. Food is ok but overpriced. Read on for details...

DRINKS: My husband ordered a margarita w/ No salt. Guess what, it came with salt. (Strike one). And it took 25 minutes for them to come cuz the ran out of triple sec (strike 2). Poor planning on them cuz the prickly pear margaritas were on special! It tasted good though and u would have ordered two except that the were small portions (wine glass portion) for 8 bucks.  Next I ordered a blue moon (one of the few "good" beer options) which came in a glass...not pint. Our server didn't even mention the size. At least they got the Orange wedge right.

FOOD: Grandpa ordered fried chicken and loved it. My husband and cousin got fajitas, I got sirloin streak, and other cousin got pork sandwich. The fajitas come on a sizzling plate with an extra plate of sides. Smelled and looked delicious, but by the time the tortillas arrived (we had to ask for them), there was no more sizzle and food was cold (Strike 3). Also they forgot to bring me my steak (STRIKE 4) so after everyone else's food came (except for tortillas) We had to wait about 7 mins for our server to return and ask if we needed anything. Finally, she brought out my steak and tortillas 10 mins after everyone's food arrived. Steak was cold cuz of the wait, but it was cooked perfectly how I liked it. Oh, watch out for the skimpy dinner salad, though. It's a cheap dole salad with only lettuce with barely any carrot and red cabbage shavings. Big disappointment.  

BILL: I was hopeful our server was smart enough to recognize the shitty service we had and offer up free dessert or something, but she wasn't that smart! We were charged full prices for everything. I pulled her aside and mentioned my frustration. Then she took off the tortillas and gave us dessert. This was her saving grace. 

Overall, they get one star for the bill compromise and one star for food taste. But service and prices were pretty bad.

Extremely nice and welcoming staff.  Super affordable prices.  Very good comfort food.  A carnivore's heaven with burgers, steak and even liver!  

We had the Fried Chicken and it was quite good. 

Friend had the liver and onions and she raved about its flavor and crispness. 

The Bourbon Mules were yummmmmmy. 

The piece de resistance ~ Strawberry Shortcake!! Huge.  Heavenly.

For a destination touristy place, surprisingly good food!
Wife and I shared a full fried Chicken, served with fries and cole slaw. I wanted to try the ribs, so ordered a half rack.
French fries were excellent, crispy coating delicious.
Cole slaw fresh and really good.  The chicken was the best we have had in years. Nicely seasoned crunchy skin, yet juicy and perfectly cooked .Big juicy pieces, not some overgrown pigeon!
The ribs were very good, but rather pricy. Needed the BBQ sauce accompanying to flavor them up, but nicely cooked and good quality.
Finished up with the renowned strawberry shortcake. Perfect finish to a very pleasant and satisfying meal.
Good service, good value, good food. This place is the real thing and a deserving winner.
Can't wait to return!!!

Maybe it was the lick of the draw and I just got a bad batch but I came into this restaurant last night with my boyfriend for a late dinner.

Our server was awesome. Very sweet and was on top of everything. 

I got a side salad and a bowl of chili. In my opinion the chili needed some kick to it. It was slightly bland. The side salad was much larger than I thought so kudos go then! I'm not sure what happened but I ended up not feeling well immediately after eating the chili. I ended up in the bathroom at the end of the night. At the restaurant My boyfriend had a pulled pork sandwich. It seemed to have been heated up in a microwave or something it was much hotter than a normal pulled pork sandwich. 

Food gets a C and service gets a A+

Tourist trap!  This place is for children and retired people.

This is nothing special in regards to good food.  It's just a touristy... I don't even know.  I think people just want to say that they've dined at the Horny Toad like it's a funny joke or something.  In reality, the only thing funny is the fact that you're going to overpay for your experience there... wait... that's not funny.
